document.masterDocTitle: An annotated checklist of the praYing mantises (Mantodea) of Borneo, including the results of the 2008 scientific expedition to Lanjak Entimau Wildlife SanctuarY, Sarawak

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An annotated checklist of the praYing mantises (Mantodea) of Borneo, including the results of the 2008 scientific expedition to Lanjak Entimau Wildlife SanctuarY, Sarawak

bibRefCitation.author: Burmeister
bibRefCitation.refString: Burmeister, H. (1838) Fangheuschrecken. Mantodea. In: Handbuch der Entomologie. Zweiter Band. Besondere Entomologie. Zweite Abtheilung. Kaukerfe, Gymnognatha (Erste Halfte; vulgo Orthoptera). Enslin, Berlin, pp. 517 - 552.

subSubSection.paragraph:
=
Ephierodula
Giglio-Tos, 1912

=
Parhierodula
Giglio-Tos, 1912

Highly diversified, taxonomically difficult genus in urgent need of revision, distributed with 104 species over the S Palearctic, Oriental and Australo-Papuan region. Paraphyletic with respect to
Rhombodera
Burmeister, 1838
,
Tamolanica
Werner, 1923
and other related genera. Sixteen species currently known from Borneo. Generalist ambush hunter, exhibiting green/brown polyphenism. Arboricolous, also on high weeds and scrubs, in forests and disturbed habitats.

bibRefCitation.author: Olivier
bibRefCitation.refString: Olivier, A. G. (1792) Mante. In: Encyclopedie methodique. Histoire naturelle. Insectes. Tome 7 ieme. Panckoucke, Paris, pp. 616 - 642.

subSubSection.paragraph:
=
Mantis conspurcata
Lichtenstein , 1796

=
Mantis punctata
Stoll, 1813
(f)

=
Mantis vitrea
Stoll, 1813
(m)

=
Mantis ( Hierodula ) hybrida
Burmeister, 1838

=
Mantis bankae
Giebel, 1861

=
Mantis similis
Giebel, 1861

=
Hierodula novemdentata
Saussure, 1869

=
Hierodula athene
Rehn, 1909

Distribution. India , Myanmar , Sumatra, Nias, Java, Borneo, Labuan, Sulawesi, S Philippines (
Giglio-Tos, 1912
, 1927 ,
Hebard 1920
,
Werner 1921
, 1933 ,
Beier 1958
,
Ehrmann 2002
).

Remarks.
H. venosa
is one of the most widespread and most variable species of this genus within the Sunda Archipelago, as it becomes obvious from its long list of synonyms. Additional names might still be attributable to this species, such as
H. vitreoides
Giglio-Tos, 1912
, as suggested by
Hebard ( 1920 )
. However, the validity of the synonymous taxa should be re-evaluated.

bibRefCitation.author: Stal
bibRefCitation.refString: Stal, C. (1877) Systema Mantodeorum. Essai d'une systematisation nouvelle des Mantodees. Bihang till Kongliga Svenska Vetenskaps Akademiens Handlingar, 4 (10), 1 - 91, 1 pl.

subSubSection.paragraph:
=
Hierodula stigmata Brunner
von Wattenwyl, 1898

Distribution. Thailand (?), Borneo, Labuan (
Hebard 1920
,
Giglio-Tos 1927
,
Ehrmann 2002
). Bornean records. Sarawak : Mt. Dulit (
Beier 1937
); Sabah: Mt. Kinabalu (Brunner von Wattenwyl 1898 ; OK

in situ ), Maliau Basin (OK in situ ), Poring Hot Springs ( SMNK ), Labuan Island (
Hebard 1920
). Remarks. The specimen from Thailand mentioned by
Rehn ( 1903 )
is considered by
Giglio-Tos ( 1927 )
to belong to a different species. The synonymy of
H. stigmata Brunner
von Wattenwyl, 1898 , not mentioned in
Ehrmann ( 2002 )
, was established by
Kirby ( 1904 )
and confirmed by
Hebard ( 1920 )
.

bibRefCitation.author: Westwood
bibRefCitation.refString: Westwood, J. O. (1889) Revisio insectorum familiae mantidarum, speciebus novis aut minus cognitis descriptis et delineates. Gurney & Jackson, London, 54 + III pp., 14 pls.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. NE India , Malay Peninsula, Sumatra, Java, Borneo (
Westwood 1889
,
Werner 1933
,
Beier 1958
,
Ehrmann 2002
).

Hierodula modesta modesta Brunner
von Wattenwyl, 1898

Distribution. Borneo, Sulawesi (Brunner von Wattenwyl 1898 ,
Giglio-Tos 1927
,
Ehrmann 2002
). Bornean records. Sarawak : Baram River (Brunner von Wattenwyl 1898 ).

bibRefCitation.author: Kirby
bibRefCitation.refString: Kirby, W. F. (1904) A synonymic catalogue of Orthoptera. Vol. I. Orthoptera Euplexoptera, Cursoria, et Gressoria. British Museum (Natural History), London, X + 501 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph:
=
Hierodula notata Brunner
von Wattenwyl, 1898 ( nec
Stoll, 1813
)

Distribution. N Borneo, Flores (?) (Brunner von Wattenwyl 1898 ,
Kirby 1904
,
Giglio-Tos 1912
).
Bornean record. Sabah: Mt. Kinabalu (Brunner von Wattenwyl 1898 ).

Remarks. There is some confusion in the literature between this species and
Mantis notata
Stoll, 1813
(m). The latter is regarded as a synonym of
H. unimaculata (
Olivier, 1792
)
(
Beier 1935 c
,
Ehrmann 2002
,
Otte & Spearman 2005
).
H. everetti
was chosen by
Kirby ( 1904 )
as replacement name for
H. notata Brunner
v. Wattenwyl, 1898 to resolve the homonymy to
Mantis notata
Stoll, 1813
.
Ehrmann ( 2002 )
treats
H. everetti
as valid, but erroneously considers Brunner v. Wattenwyl ( 1898 ) to have credited Stoll’s species, so he assigns
H. notata (
Stoll, 1813
)
as its synonym. The locality “ Flores ” given in
Kirby ( 1904 )
needs confirmation.

bibRefCitation.refString: Werner, F. (1906) Zur Kenntnis afrikanischer Mantodeen. Jahreshefte des Vereins fur Vaterlandische Naturkunde in Wurttemberg, 62 (34), 361 - 377.

subSubSection.paragraph:
=
Hierodula inermis
Werner, 1911

Distribution. Malay Peninsula, Sunda Islands, Kei Islands (
Werner 1911
, 1916 ,
1933
,
Giglio-Tos 1912
,
Ehrmann 2002
).
Remarks. There is also a photographic record of this species from Danum Valley, Sabah (Drescher, pers. comm.).
